revised_title: Anatomical and Physiological Examination of Efferent Fibres in the Lumbo-Sacral Plexus
tldr: The author examines the distribution and function of efferent fibers in the lumbo-sacral plexus of various animals, including Macacus, frog, rat, rabbit, cat, and dog. The study reveals significant individual variation in the anatomical and physiological constitution of these fibers, leading to the recognition of a 'pre-axial' and 'post-axial' class of innervation for each muscle and movement.
